solution.text:
Money spent on bus = cost per head of bus x number of students = 100 x _{j}_ =Rs. _{{100*j}}_
Money spent on taxi = cost per head of taxi x number of students = 200 x _{k}_ = Rs. _{{200*k}}_
\( \Rightarrow \) Hence, Ratio of money spent on bus to money spent on taxi = \(\frac{_{{100*j}}_}{_{{200*k}}_} \) = _{j}_:_{{2*k}}_

content.text: The cost of going to school is Rs.100 per head by bus, Rs.200 per head by taxi and by auto-rickshaw is Rs.150 per head. If _{j}_ students go by bus, _{k}_ students by taxi and _{{12-j-k}}_ students go by auto rickshaw. What is the ratio of the money spent on bus to the money spent on taxi?
